        <div class="grid-container" id="main-content">
                            <div class="grid-x grid-margin-x">
    <div class="small-12 medium-12 large-9 cell">

        <div class="grid-x bg-white grid-padding-x grid-padding-y" style="width: 100%; position: relative;" itemtype="http://schema.org/Product" itemscope><div class="cell small-12" id="toptop"><h1 <div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_1" v-pre>
</div></div></div><div class="grid-x grid-margin-x grid-margin-y"><div class="cell small-6"><likes-rating :perfume_id="8636" chart="show" type-chart="small-chart" colors="retro"></likes-rating></div><div class="cell small-6"><seasons-rating :perfume_id="8636" chart="show" type-chart="small-chart" colors="retro"></seasons-rating></div><div class="small-12 medium-6 text-center" style="max-height: 50px"><div itemprop="aggregateRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/AggregateRating" itemscope><p class="info-note">Perfume rating&nbsp;<span itemprop="ratingValue">3.95</span>&nbsp;out of&nbsp;<span itemprop="bestRating">5</span> with&nbsp;<span itemprop="ratingCount" content="476">476</span> votes<meta itemprop="reviewCount" content="49"/></p></div></div></div><div class="grid-x grid-margin-x grid-margin-y"><div class="cell small-12" itemprop="description" v-pre><p><b>Orange Blossom</b> by <b>Penhaligon's</b> is a Oriental Floral fragrance for women. <b>Orange Blossom</b> was launched in 2010. The nose behind this fragrance is Bertrand Duchaufour. Top notes are Neroli, Bergamot, Violet Leaf, Amalfi Lemon, Pink Pepper and Cardamon; middle notes are Orange, Tuberose, Jasmine, Peach Blossom, Orchid and Rose; base notes are Musk, Sandalwood, Virginia Cedar and Vanille. </p><div v-pre class='fragrantica-blockquote'><p>Perfumer Bertrand Duchaufour updated the classic scent in 2010.</p></div><p class="reviewstrigger" style="font-size: smaller; color: #83a6c4">Read about this perfume in other languages: <a href="https://www.fragrantica.de/Parfum/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Deutsch</a>,  <a                     Not enough creaminess to like it
                </div>
                            <div class="cell small-12" style="display: inline-flex; margin: 0.4rem;word-wrap: break-word;padding: 0 0.6rem 0 0.6rem;">

                    Messy and overwhelming
                </div>

    <div class="strike-title"><span>All Reviews By Date</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
        <div class="cell destinationreview"></div>                    <div id="parent2322286" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2322286" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="GirlOnFire"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1231923"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="GirlOnFire" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Rochas/Byzance-1423.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1423.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Byzance"title="Byzance"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2322286ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2322286" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1231923">GirlOnFire</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-20">10/20/24 20:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I find this to be such an underrated perfume; a wonderful tribute to the orange blossom. It can be worn comfortably in all seasons. It is not diapery powder but something more refined. I feel especially healthy and somewhat beautifully earthy when Ive gotten a medium natural tan, my skin is moisturised and glowing, and Im fit, wearing this fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="2322286"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=2322286#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2261599" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2261599" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="EkaterinaIvanova"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1671930"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1671930.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="EkaterinaIvanova" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Lavalliere-76844.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.76844.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lavalliere"title="Lavalliere"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2261599ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2261599" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1671930">EkaterinaIvanova</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-26">08/26/24 11:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Found the last bottle of this discontinued beauty in Penhaligons boutique in Edinburgh. Its fresh, feminine, very sensual fragrance, which makes you feel real good about yourself. I guess that there are plenty of white florals fragrances available which made people neglect Penhaligons Orange Blossom and as a result got it discontinued. However, if you like this profile and still can find it in the store, please give it a try! You are fresh from shower, wearing a pretty white dress in a garden full of greens and flowers and all you have to do is enjoy here and now. Not too bad, ha?! Husband loves it on me too!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="2261599"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=2261599#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2231983" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="2231983"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=2231983#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2108134" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2108134" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="GracieLions"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1821289"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1821289.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="GracieLions" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Mojave-Ghost-27040.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.27040.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mojave Ghost"title="Mojave Ghost"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2108134ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2108134" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1821289">GracieLions</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-29">03/29/24 13:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is the perfect summer scent! Very gentle, clean, floral orange blossom, not a bitter or woody neroli. It's a young fragrance, very innocent, paired perfectly with a touch of jasmine and peach; the faint note of tuberose helps to ground it. Inoffensive and beautiful perfume. A safe blind buy if you like suble florals, or if you wish to layer an orange blossom over another soft scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="2108134"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=2108134#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2031234" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2031234" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mimil624"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1681872"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1681872.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mimil624" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2031234ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2031234" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1681872">mimil624</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-14">01/14/24 22:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i think this fragrance has macerated quite a bit because it is so much creamier smelling now and lasts longer than when i first opened it several months ago. it was a blind buy because penhaligons was having a huge sale of unboxed inventory. i think this is a very true orange blossom. honestly i dont pick up on any other notes except maybe a bit of musk. its grown on me a lot. i dont know why, but for some reason this seems to me what joan didion would have smelled like. something about it just exudes california in the 1970s, in a grove of orange trees by a patio and pool in spring. its a little mature but not to a point where i feel like i as a 23 year old smell too old when i wear it. its just creamy and nice. i dont think its worth the full price however. it lasts about 5 hours on me. i adore penhaligons bottles so i love the look of this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="2031234"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=2031234#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73); padding: 0; border: none; margin: 0;"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6 -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6" v-pre>
</div></div><div id="parent2021901" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2021901" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="elizabells"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1919495"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="elizabells" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2021901ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2021901" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1919495">elizabells</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-05">01/05/24 20:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I grew up with a huge navel orange tree in my garden and this fragrance makes me wonder if perhaps orange blossoms are an entirely different species of flower in England. There is nothing but soapy powdery musk on my skin. Nothing floral, no citrus at all, just a headache and regrets.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="2021901"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=2021901#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2018134" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2018134" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pearldiving"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1942295"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1942295.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pearldiving" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Solstice-Scents/Sea-Of-Gray-51256.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51256.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sea Of Gray"title="Sea Of Gray"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2018134ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2018134" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1942295">pearldiving</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-02">01/02/24 15:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Opens with sharp and slightly medicinal greens, evolving into sweet woody florals after some time on the skin. I didnt get much citrus definitely picked up on the neroli, though. I was surprised at how heavy I found this scent, and the medicinal note, kind of like ointment? Ultimately a very complex scent that evolves a lot on the skin annd ends with warm white floral drydown. I would imagine it would fit well in a springtime garden party.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="2018134"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=2018134#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1967137" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1967137" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="HopeEliza"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1854653"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1854653.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="HopeEliza" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Delina-43871.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43871.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Delina"title="Delina"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1967137ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1967137" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1854653">HopeEliza</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-02">11/02/23 17:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a truly authentic orange blossom scent. It's not necessarily what I would call pretty, but it has depth and complexity and is quite intoxicating. It opens with a burst of citrus and leafy/stemmy notes, before settling down into a deep and slightly soapy neroli, with woody undertones. It's very much a 'whole tree' scent. I do understand the criticism that it might seem overly masculine or rough to some people. Orange blossom has never been a delicate scent to me, but I wouldn't call it masculine either. To me this scent is truly unisex and ageless. I'm very interested to compare it to Jo Malone's take on orange blossom.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="1967137"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=1967137#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1903460" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Some may say its linear but it isnt for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="1903460"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=1903460#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1888928" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; <br />
First spray just made me forget<br />
about this melting weather.<br />
<br />
Look at this variety of notes, its just so many of them but surprisingly nothing pops out or play separately.    The combination is just so right and they only make the orange flower even prettier. Very suitable for summer. <br />
<br />
Its the simplest citrus scent ive ever tired but i want to give it the highest value.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="1877005"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=1877005#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1859002" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I love the crayon scent in it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="1859002"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=1859002#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1837523" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1837523" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mad_mal"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1561708"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1561708.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mad_mal" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1837523ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1837523" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1561708">mad_mal</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-20">05/20/23 03:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I tested this on my arm with Chabaud's Orangerie Musicale on the other. Its summer where I'm at (31 degrees Celsius).<br />
<br />
It opens with a blast of citrus and A LOT of FLORALS. It smells like lotion or soap to me and leans on the "classier" side of fragrances (compared to Orangerie Musicale which, IMO leans on the "fun and pretty" side). This is a good choice for summer or spring. As it dries down, it becomes a floral-woody combo on my skin (Orangerie Musicale dries off sweet and floral on my skin due to the sugar-almond-vanilla combo). <br />
<br />
I actually prefer Orangerie Musicale to this. But I like this better than Diptyque Eau des Sens. des Sens is too sharp on my skin and it smells really synthetic on me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="1837523"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=1837523#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1830684" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1830684" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Vickalicious"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/59086"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.59086.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Vickalicious" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Aedes-de-Venustas/Iris-Nazarena-18451.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18451.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Iris Nazarena"title="Iris Nazarena"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1830684ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1830684" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/59086">Vickalicious</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-11">05/11/23 13:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a really nice orange blossom fragrance. As others have mentioned, it does encompass the entire orange tree with woody, green, and soapy floral aspects to it. I actually love this scent, but the performance is atrocious (at least the current formulation). If it performed better on me this would be full bottle worthy. I find this similar to Obvious' Une Fleur d'Oranger and Diptyque Eau des Sens.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="1830684"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=1830684#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1737116" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1737116" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Neverapeoplepleaser"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1664252"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1664252.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Neverapeoplepleaser" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mancera/Hindu-Kush-49030.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49030.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hindu Kush"title="Hindu Kush"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1737116ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1737116" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1664252">Neverapeoplepleaser</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-18">01/18/23 08:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This has to be one of the most beautiful smells, ever. I've watched a review of this, whereby someone describes this perfume as encompassing the whole orange tree...and I totally agree. Elegant, beautiful, summery, happy, refined. I just can't stop smelling myself when I wear this. A wonderful spring/ summer scent. As with all Penhaligons...quite expensive. But this is one that I will always repurchase. Well worth it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="1737116"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=1737116#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1720245" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Orange blossom meets other flowers. Slightly on the feminine side of unisex but I love wearing it. on me this is almost too heavy for spring. Small hints of jasmine in the background. Zero tuberose, thankfully. It's light and fresh and sophisticated. Nothing like Diptyque Do Son, which is heavy tuberose and gardenia. Really lovely, summer scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="1504756"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=1504756#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1426426" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; This is good, so that I can reach for it and enjoy it when I want! <br />
A good spring/summer scent, but I could see myself wearing it in any season.<br />
It doesn't project very much on my skin, but I think it fits very well.<br />
<br />
I just layered this with Tom Ford's Beau de Jour, and it is fantastic hehe</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="1426426"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=1426426#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1363252" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1363252" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Carly430"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1353384"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Carly430" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1363252ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1363252" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1353384">Carly430</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-20">06/20/21 16:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I recently received a sample of Orange Blossom, and sadly, this fragrance expressed far too powdery on my skin. The neroli and tuberose diminished within the first minute, and the cloyingly sweet powder notes took over, giving me a headache. Within 5 minutes of applying, I could only detect rose, jasmine and musk buried in a powder cloud. Maybe this one isn't compatible with my body chemistry, would be willing to try other Penhaligon's fragrances with different notes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="1363252"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=1363252#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1363090" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Good sillage for first 3 hours. Turns a bit soapy on my skin after an hour or so. Not bad, but wouldn't buy a full bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="1363090"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=1363090#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1351560" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1351560" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Vanian"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/132632"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.132632.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Vanian" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1351560ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1351560" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/132632">Vanian</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-30">05/30/21 04:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sampled this in the shop a week, or so ago. I felt instantly in love with this so realistic orange blossom frag. I actually was in the shop to buy The Ruthless Duchess Dorothea and after the shop assistant applied OB on my wrist I knew I will definitely get it as soon as I can, for now I only got the hand and body wash. Pure bliss in my morning shower.  <br />
Orange blossom is obviously about the flower itself, however there are more notes which makes it very sophisticated and elegant and yes there is this kind of soapy clean feel attached to it as well, but not like in a detergent product, and like in a freshly washed skin with a luxurious soap. Really love that one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="1351560"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=1351560#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1345487" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1345487" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lovetribe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/501028"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.501028.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lovetribe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1345487ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1345487" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/501028">lovetribe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-18">05/18/21 16:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>too many not well mixed notes.<br />
a mess.<br />
the tuberose orange blossom mix is excellent, but it is a pale imitation of the masterpiece serge lutense fleurs d'orange mixed with the great castile. 5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="1345487"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=1345487#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1262467" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1262467" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alixiialice"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1263568"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1263568.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alixiialice" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Celine/Black-Tie-57925.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57925.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Tie"title="Black Tie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1262467ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1262467" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1263568">alixiialice</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-12-18">12/18/20 02:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tuberose disguised in an orange blossom bottle. <br />
<br />
The top notes are very tame, transparent and complex. Citrus from neroli, transparency from violet leaves, a hint of contrast from pink pepper. So far, it's true to its name. After 20-30 minutes, this fragrance unfurls into a tuberose scent on me. A touch of orange can be detected. The orange note is sweet rather than zesty or overly citrusy. After the transparent top notes are gone, the perfume becomes quite dense and plush. The tuberose in the heart is similar to Diptyque's Do Son edp, opaque and peppery. This dries down to a sandalwood-heavy musk. The more time I allow this scent to develop, the more intense it gets. <br />
<br />
I agree with a previous reviewer who mentioned the interchangeability with Diptyque's Do Son. The expression of tuberose is very similar between the two fragrances, having said that, Penhaligon's is overall more complex and offers a old-world-like muddier, woody dry down.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="1262467"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=1262467#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1231167" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1231167" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="juljan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1234706"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1234706.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="juljan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Caron/Pour-Un-Homme-de-Caron-3166.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3166.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pour Un Homme de Caron"title="Pour Un Homme de Caron"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1231167ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1231167" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1234706">juljan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-10-01">10/01/20 00:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>box stamped 83471, online order from penhaligon in uk:<br />
<br />
i don't get it. for me, feeble orange. although sprayed on my skin, the effect is as if it were sprayed on cardboard. flat, no projection at all. doesn't seem to warm up or expand with time.<br />
<br />
after reading all the positive reviews, i was hoping for a light orange punch, uplifting and sunny. since i have only a few neroli/orange fragrances, i wanted to explore additions to my citrus grouping because i love the smell of freshly peeled oranges and mandarins. having lived in california where orange trees with their neon orange fruit provide an aura of perky sunshine through the winter months, i wanted something that could be fun in warm weather and cheery in the colder. <br />
<br />
maybe a cool overcast day is not the right time, but i was hoping to brighten things a little.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="1231167"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=1231167#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1157011" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1157011" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="HyacinthBucket"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/208269"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.208269.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="HyacinthBucket" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Royal-Crown/Upper-Class-38230.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.38230.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Upper Class"title="Upper Class"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1157011ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1157011" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/208269">HyacinthBucket</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-03-20">03/20/20 21:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Penhaligon's  has perfectly captured a warm evening spent relaxing among orange trees, their intoxicating flowers in full bloom. Theres a little citrus in the air but the star of the show is creamy, sweet, honeyed orange blossom.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="1157011"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=1157011#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1079088" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1079088" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Pempipot"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1178494"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1178494.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Pempipot" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atelier-Cologne/Cafe-Tuberosa-45964.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.45964.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Caf Tuberosa"title="Caf Tuberosa"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1079088ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1079088" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1178494">Pempipot</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-07-15">07/15/19 14:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lovely scent: so fresh and sweet, it smells like a beautiful summer night in the country. Neroli and orange are prominent but the tuberose is so creamy and sweet, so enchanting. It's rather rare to find a fresh smell that manages to layer some sweetness without getting cloying or boring: this does it perfectly.<br />
<br />
As with others Penhaligon's classics, sillage isn't a strong point: it's a quiet scent, that stays close to the skin and even longevity isn't great. In 4 hours is gone. Pity, for such a wonderful scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="1079088"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=1079088#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1060076" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
