padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1185528">chrisk252</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-05-13">05/13/19 16:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very pleasant,sweet, soft, floral citrus opening. Drydown is slightly sweet floral. Very nice, but more for women. 8/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="1060076"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=1060076#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1051979" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1051979" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="HOUSTONHOUSTON"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1010475"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1010475.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="HOUSTONHOUSTON" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1051979ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1051979" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1010475">HOUSTONHOUSTON</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-04-17">04/17/19 16:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you already have Do Son Diptique - you do not need Orange Blossom Penhaligons. <br />
The opening is too similar. More citrycy version of Do Son to my nose. If you do not have Do Son - this frag is lovely, floral, feminine, summery!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="1051979"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=1051979#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1021793" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1021793" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="what is this I don&#039;t even"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/941289"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.941289.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="what is this I don&#039;t even" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Galimard/Brindille-10702.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10702.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Brindille"title="Brindille"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1021793ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1021793" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/941289">what is this I don&#039;t even</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-01-18">01/18/19 04:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is gorgeous and gives my current favorite orange blossom perfume (Houbigant's) serious competition.  I love the sparkling zesty orange note here that balances out the heady orange blossom note (that can get quite stuffy and bathroom-cleaner'ish in other renditions).  Lovely perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="1021793"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=1021793#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent952153" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc952153" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Badjohana"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1133908"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Badjohana" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma952153ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd952153" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1133908">Badjohana</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-06-13">06/13/18 13:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love this one.  I adore Orange blossom and there are quite a few scents out there, but many opt for a light, fresh, summer cologne approach but i prefer my Orange blossom to have  oomph and sexiness and very few scents go down that path.  This one does,there is sensuality, depth and presence, a strong body rather than the light ephemerality  that appears to be de rigueur with so many Orange Blossom.  It has some sweetness which I am comfortable with  but it is not  cloying and  as with most Penhaligon's creations, it has complexity and multiple layers. As I said....I love it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="952153"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=952153#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent946222" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc946222" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bubbles1964"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1095199"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1095199.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bubbles1964" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bastide-Aix-en-Provence/Figue-Amour-48974.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48974.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Figue Amour"title="Figue Amour"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma946222ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd946222" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1095199">Bubbles1964</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-05-24">05/24/18 23:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Nice neroli comfort scent, long lasting for an EDT: over 4 hours and it hasn't turned into a skin scent. I agree with other reviewers that there is a lot going on in this bottle, I can't pull out all the individual notes. That doesn't compromise the scent, or my opinion, I still like it. <br />
<br />
Maybe not groundbreaking but I can imagine I would find a lot of opportunites to wear OB. Contemplating a purchase.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="946222"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=946222#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent866889" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc866889" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="smellme11"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1070151"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1070151.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="smellme11" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Oriza-L-Legrand/Empire-des-Indes-72955.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72955.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Empire des Indes"title="Empire des Indes"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma866889ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd866889" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1070151">smellme11</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-10-02">10/02/17 18:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This scent reminds me of vintage 80s Orange Flower Water by Crabtree &amp; Evelyn. It came in an indigo blue glass bottle and I was so sad to see it discontinued. I'm getting the same kind of vibe from Penhaligon's Orange Blossom, except naturally the Penhaligon's is much more potent...more than a few squirts and you run the risk of overdose. Bertrand Duchaufour did a masterful job with Orange Blossom. I react to "musk" differently than most people, it can really be a turn-off for me, but here in OB, it is not an issue whatsoever.  Nor is the "citrus" an issue, which my skin chemicals normally mutate into something ghastly, here in OB, it is lively and fresh throughout the opening and mid-way point.  Sometimes the indole factor in certain jasmine varieties can be somewhat revolting, but here in OB, I'm not detecting any indole skank at all. This is for the most part a white floral scent, yet halfway through, the rose becomes quite apparent. I normally have issues with rose being mixed with, just about everything, but here in OB, it somehow works. Perhaps it's a white rose. The tuberose is spectacular, on par with Fracas. My hat goes off to Monsieur Duchaufour for crafting this amazing white floral fantasy.  I am also a big fan of his "Sartorial", also from Penhaligon's.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="866889"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=866889#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent815639" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc815639" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Truffles_L"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/995517"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.995517.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Truffles_L" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/Fiore-d-Ulivo-6311.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6311.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fiore d'Ulivo"title="Fiore d'Ulivo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma815639ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd815639" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/995517">Truffles_L</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-04-23">04/23/17 12:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Orange Blossom is a comforting scent for me that creates an aura of calm. It has a creamy neroli and soft white floral opening. The drydown turns a bit more like sandalwood. I love Orange Blossom for before bed or when I want a tranquil feeling around me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="815639"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=815639#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent746255" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc746255" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Southern Blonde"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/981525"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.981525.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Southern Blonde" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Sarah-Jessica-Parker/Lovely-993.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.993.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lovely"title="Lovely"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma746255ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd746255" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/981525">Southern Blonde</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-09-26">09/26/16 06:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Orange blossom is an orange grove in the spring time. Cool breezes caress the orange trees and bring out the aroma. This is a delicious orange scented perfume. If you like orange blossom, this will scratch your itch. It smells exactly like orange blossom. But it has other things going on. At the first spritz it's a neroli and citrus. Fresh, sharp, and enjoyable although quite strong. The other floral notes that join the orange blossom include rose jasmine tuberose and orchid. They can't always be detected but the rose is a citrus-rose not a green rose or powdery rose. The jasmine is also present. The citrus/orange blossom lingers the whole time and finally the fragrance dries down to woods and vanilla. Mature, elegant, fresh and floral. I wear this in the summer time and to wedding gigs where I perform as a paid wedding singer. Orange blossom is a traditional bridal flower, but one that has become less popular compared to white flowers of gardenia and lily of the valley. I do love my orange blossoms.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="746255"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=746255#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent729304" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc729304" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jamiljames"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/934469"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.934469.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jamiljames" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/The-Library-Collection-Opus-VI-14661.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14661.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Library Collection Opus VI"title="The Library Collection Opus VI"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma729304ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd729304" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/934469">Jamiljames</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-08-03">08/03/16 15:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am wearing this scent combined with Douro also from Penhaligon's. I really like the pureness of the Neroli that comes through in this creation. I think this is the kind of scent that an individual would wear for their own pleasure rather than for the enjoyment of others.<br />
What is most enjoyable about this scent is the subtlety. Neroli is the dominant note in my mind. I am currently wearing it on top of a multiple of scents; I washed with Molton Brown's Bushukan and applied Blenheim Bouquet lotion on top. A generous spray of Penhaligon's Douro followed by Orange Blossom to finish. The end result is a nice smell of citrus on the skin. I feel the Orange Blossom can mix well with many Penhaligon's scents. I think it would combine amazingly with  Juniper Sling.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="729304"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=729304#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent695142" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc695142" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="genericjanedoe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/261926"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.261926.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="genericjanedoe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma695142ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd695142" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/261926">genericjanedoe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-04-10">04/10/16 06:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bought this at a bargain price and for a long while, it remained in its attractive black packaging. When I finally got around to uncorking the bottle and taking an initial splash, I found it just a pleasant orange, but nothing more.<br />
<br />
Revisited again recently and really took time to explore the scent, I was pleasantly surprised to discover that there is so much more to it than the sparkly bright orange notes I had picked up and dismissed. <br />
<br />
On first application I immediately smell orange and (strangely) smoke - quickly followed by an overwhelming bergamot, which with earlier notes gives an impression of sun-bleached grass. This layer lingers like the diva's end note - but for the duration of the song. <br />
<br />
Although the perfume doesn't contain it, I detected what smelled like incense starting to peek through somewhere in dry down - it must have been the sandalwood. The orange disappears, and is replaced with a musky base note and spicy vanilla essence which clings to the skin and reminds me of the faint scent of old paper and hot dusty library. I admit that this is perhaps not everyone's idea of lovely, but then I've always enjoyed the scent of things that others find odd - like incense, tarmac and creosote.<br />
<br />
Penhaligon's Orange Blossom is a warm and comforting scent, a long-lasting base note clinger with very little sillage (at least on me anyway). I can't stop breathing it in.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="695142"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=695142#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent693488" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc693488" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Akashia"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/996211"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Akashia" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Dior-Addict-215.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.215.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dior Addict"title="Dior Addict"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma693488ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd693488" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/996211">Akashia</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-04-04">04/04/16 18:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>All I can smell is bitter violet leaves from this perfume. Later on it turns very faint vanilla.<br />
I was expecting floral, refreshing blooming perfume.<br />
Unfortunately, this perfume doesn't meet up my expectation.<br />
Very disappointing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="693488"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=693488#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent649326" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc649326" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="canny1234"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/789543"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.789543.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="canny1234" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Miller-Harris/Le-Jasmin-23219.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.23219.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Le Jasmin"title="Le Jasmin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma649326ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd649326" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/789543">canny1234</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-11-19">11/19/15 03:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a beautiful fresh orange Neroli perfume enriched and made creamy and slightly Indolic with Tuberose and Jasmine.This is followed by a warm woody Drydown.There is enough warmth for this floral to be worn in cooler weather and longevity is pretty good.The warmth can be attenuated by combining with Jo Malone Nutmeg and Ginger which shares a comparable Cedar base.<br />
    Orange Blossom is a highly underrated stunning rich Orange Blossom fragrance that is vastly superior to the Sweet popular orange Blossom scents that currently seem to rule the roost.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/198518">40plus&amp;fab</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-12-02">12/02/12 06:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I've sampled a lot from this house and while I think they do a lovely job with their frags, florals and green scents rarely work with my skin and thus nothing from this house really suits me.  If you're a floral/green scent person I say they are worthy of a try.  With that said, of those I've tried, I find Orange Blossom the most pleasing on my skin and to my taste. With the notes I was expecting a "citrus" but It is a lovely soft and creamy neroli, clean and soapy as others have stated, sweetish and very comforting on my skin. Nice.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="309395"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=309395#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent281650" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc281650" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alfarom"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/37900"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.37900.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alfarom" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Gris-Clair-593.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.593.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gris Clair"title="Gris Clair"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma281650ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd281650" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/37900">alfarom</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-09-02">09/02/12 02:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A sweetish orange-blossom/vanilla combo with a subtle floral accord. Nice if you like the genre but far from being a standout.<br />
<br />
Rating: 6/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="281650"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=281650#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent176585" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc176585" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Migotka"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2414"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2414.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Migotka" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Rose-31-3678.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3678.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rose 31"title="Rose 31"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma176585ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd176585" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2414">Migotka</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-08-27">08/27/11 01:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Maybe someone should tell the Penhaligon's nose than less is more? <br />
<br />
Orange Blossom is obviously a fragrance with a lot of orange blossom, but there is also a jungle of notes that end up being unrecognisable. A big floral bouquet with everything mixed in it- some spices, some woods, some flowers. But it is a bit messy. There are no phases here, just a bunch of all of those notes mixed together. A floriental scent with some greenery and musk. <br />
<br />
It definitely has got the Pehnaligon's pleasant creaminess about it which I absolutely love. But... well, it is not enough to make me like it. There is at least a dozen fantastic orange blossom fragrances I can think of at the moment that do the job a lot better.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="176585"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=176585#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent147895" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc147895" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cereza"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/27358"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.27358.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cereza" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Farmacia-SS-Annunziata/Vaniglia-del-Madagascar-9584.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9584.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vaniglia del Madagascar"title="Vaniglia del Madagascar"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma147895ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd147895" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/27358">Cereza</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-05-16">05/16/11 09:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This was so disappointing, I was expecting a lovely, feminine neroli scent, but in return I got a bitter and green mess which reminded me of some old school male cologne. Really, the fragrance is not what one could expect from such name. Anyhow, I don't like it. It's too bitter, too messy, too masculine, too rough, too soapy. Sad.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="147895"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=147895#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent130789" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc130789" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lucifera"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/17455"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.17455.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lucifera" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lalique/Le-Baiser-4210.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4210.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Le Baiser"title="Le Baiser"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma130789ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd130789" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); such a shame! i had high hopes for this, very dissapionting</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="130789"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=130789#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent96685" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc96685" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="imgcas"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/3661"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.3661.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="imgcas" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Loewe/Paula-s-Ibiza-Eclectic-73103.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.73103.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Paula's Ibiza Eclectic"title="Paula's Ibiza Eclectic"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma96685ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd96685" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/3661">imgcas</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-08-23">08/23/10 05:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Neroli and bergamote are noticeable among the top notes, and the scent is bitter and fresh.<br />
Some minutes later it softens and gets sweeter and soapier, and on my skin I get lots of orange blossom and maybe some rose.<br />
The drydown is quite sweet and musky.<br />
<br />
It has very good lasting power and medium sillage.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="96685"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=96685#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                    </div>
</div>

    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent952153" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc952153" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Badjohana"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1133908"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Badjohana" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma952153ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd952153" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1133908">Badjohana</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-06-13">06/13/18 13:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love this one.  I adore Orange blossom and there are quite a few scents out there, but many opt for a light, fresh, summer cologne approach but i prefer my Orange blossom to have  oomph and sexiness and very few scents go down that path.  This one does,there is sensuality, depth and presence, a strong body rather than the light ephemerality  that appears to be de rigueur with so many Orange Blossom.  It has some sweetness which I am comfortable with  but it is not  cloying and  as with most Penhaligon's creations, it has complexity and multiple layers. As I said....I love it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="952153"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=952153#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1507919" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1095199">Bubbles1964</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-05-24">05/24/18 23:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Nice neroli comfort scent, long lasting for an EDT: over 4 hours and it hasn't turned into a skin scent. I agree with other reviewers that there is a lot going on in this bottle, I can't pull out all the individual notes. That doesn't compromise the scent, or my opinion, I still like it. <br />
<br />
Maybe not groundbreaking but I can imagine I would find a lot of opportunites to wear OB. Contemplating a purchase.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="946222"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=946222#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="8636" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent176585" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc176585" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Migotka"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2414"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2414.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Migotka" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Rose-31-3678.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3678.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rose 31"title="Rose 31"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma176585ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd176585" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2414">Migotka</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-08-27">08/27/11 01:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Maybe someone should tell the Penhaligon's nose than less is more? <br />
<br />
Orange Blossom is obviously a fragrance with a lot of orange blossom, but there is also a jungle of notes that end up being unrecognisable. A big floral bouquet with everything mixed in it- some spices, some woods, some flowers. But it is a bit messy. There are no phases here, just a bunch of all of those notes mixed together. A floriental scent with some greenery and musk. <br />
<br />
It definitely has got the Pehnaligon's pleasant creaminess about it which I absolutely love. But... well, it is not enough to make me like it. There is at least a dozen fantastic orange blossom fragrances I can think of at the moment that do the job a lot better.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="176585"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=176585#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent147895" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc147895" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cereza"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/27358"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.27358.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cereza" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Farmacia-SS-Annunziata/Vaniglia-del-Madagascar-9584.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9584.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vaniglia del Madagascar"title="Vaniglia del Madagascar"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma147895ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd147895" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/27358">Cereza</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-05-16">05/16/11 09:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This was so disappointing, I was expecting a lovely, feminine neroli scent, but in return I got a bitter and green mess which reminded me of some old school male cologne. Really, the fragrance is not what one could expect from such name. Anyhow, I don't like it. It's too bitter, too messy, too masculine, too rough, too soapy. Sad.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="147895"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=147895#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1363252" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1363252" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Carly430"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1353384"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Carly430" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1363252ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1363252" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1353384">Carly430</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-20">06/20/21 16:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I recently received a sample of Orange Blossom, and sadly, this fragrance expressed far too powdery on my skin. The neroli and tuberose diminished within the first minute, and the cloyingly sweet powder notes took over, giving me a headache. Within 5 minutes of applying, I could only detect rose, jasmine and musk buried in a powder cloud. Maybe this one isn't compatible with my body chemistry, would be willing to try other Penhaligon's fragrances with different notes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="1363252"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=1363252#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2021901" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2021901" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="elizabells"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1919495"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="elizabells" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2021901ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2021901" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1919495">elizabells</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-05">01/05/24 20:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I grew up with a huge navel orange tree in my garden and this fragrance makes me wonder if perhaps orange blossoms are an entirely different species of flower in England. There is nothing but soapy powdery musk on my skin. Nothing floral, no citrus at all, just a headache and regrets.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="8636"comment_id="2021901"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Orange-Blossom-8636.html?ccid=2021901#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="8636" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>

                    <div style="clear:both; height: 1rem;"></div>

        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">

        </span>

<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFFe5cbbe5e5f689826b719ace22a5b2a11');
        });
    }
</script>
